instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> circuit was damaged, i replaced most of the stuff.
i also have <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7750</CHIP> replaced as there are was corrosion.

green light, orange light can charge etc. when i turn on, the fan spin for like 10sec then stop then spin again (regular fan speed)

USB mouse's light is red.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.5v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.5v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 16.6
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_MCP_REG</SIGNAL> = 1.06v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0.988v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.8v
<SIGNAL>MCPCORES0_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.29v

<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> - 1.1v.

original 85w charger.

threads.message: nvm..i've fixed. realised some resistors fall out from other side of the board while repairing, probably due to heat and movement.

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5142</RESISTOR> was hanging on its last leg and <RESISTOR>R5158</RESISTOR> was missing.
